sen.j: 八代目 市川海老蔵（はちだいめ いちかわ えびぞう、弘化2年（1845年） - 明治19年（1886年）11月12日）は幕末から明治初期の歌舞伎役者。
sen.e: The 8th Ebizo ICHIKAWA (1845 - November 12, 1886) was a Kabuki actor, who was actively played various roles from the end of Edo Period to the early Meiji Period.
Ebizo ICHIKAWA the 8th (1845 - November 12, 1886) was a Kabuki actor, who actively played various roles from the end of Edo Period to the early Meiji Period.
sen.cmt: The 8th Ebizo ICHIKAWA→Ebizo ICHIKAWA the 8thに訂正しました。（○代目△△の訳はこのように訳すのが定訳のようです）who was actively played→who actively playedに訂正しました。
sen.e: Ebizo ICHIKAWA the 8th (1845 - November 12, 1886) was a Kabuki actor, who actively played various roles from the end of Edo Period to the early Meiji Period.

sen.j: 本名は堀越壽（ほりこし ひさし）。
sen.e: His real name was Hisashi HORIKOSHI.

sen.j: 俳名は壽升（じゅしょう）。
sen.e: His Haimyo (offstage name of Kabuki actor) was Jyusho.

sen.j: 弘化2年（1845年）に市川團十郎 (7代目)の七男として大坂に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Osaka in 1845, as the 7th son of Danjyuro ICHIKAWA. (7th succession)

sen.e: He was born in Osaka in 1845, as the 7th son of Danjuro ICHIKAWA (the 7th succession).

sen.j: 初名を市川あかん平、一旦父と共に江戸に戻り安政3年（1856年）以降に四代目市川新之助と改名、その後市川寿蔵、二代目市川猿蔵と改名。
sen.e: He was originally named as Akanbei ICHIKAWA by his father, and he once moved back to Edo; (Tokyo) he later succeeded the house name of Sinnosuke ICHIKAWA (4th succession) from 1856, and later he succeeded and renamed again to Juzo ICHIKAWA, and Saruzo ICHIKAWA. (2nd succession)

He was originally named as Akanbei ICHIKAWA, and he once moved back to Edo (Tokyo) with his father; he later renamed Shinnosuke ICHIKAWA the 4th after 1856, and later he renamed again to Juzo ICHIKAWA, and Saruzo ICHIKAWA the 2nd.
sen.cmt: by his father→原文に無いため削除しました。「父と共に」の訳漏れを訂正しました。(Tokyo)→Edoの直後に置くよう訂正しました。succeeded the house name of→renamedに訂正しました。Sinnosuke ICHIKAWA (4th succession)→Shinnosuke ICHIKAWA the 4thに訂正しました。from 1856→after 1856に訂正しました。he succeeded and renamed→he renamedに訂正しました。Saruzo ICHIKAWA. (2nd succession)→Saruzo ICHIKAWA the 2nd.に訂正しました。
sen.e: He was originally named as Akanbei ICHIKAWA, and he once moved back to Edo (Tokyo) with his father; he later renamed Shinnosuke ICHIKAWA the 4th after 1856, and later he renamed again to Juzo ICHIKAWA, and Saruzo ICHIKAWA the 2nd.

sen.j: 明治3年頃に再び関西に出向くが明治14年（1881年）に八代目市川海老蔵を襲名するために上京した。
sen.e: He temporally moved back and stayed in Kansai Region in 1870, but once again he headed to Tokyo in 1881 in order to succeed the name of the 8th Ebizo ICHIKAWA.
He temporarily moved back and stayed in Kansai Region in around 1870, but once again he headed to Tokyo in 1881 in order to succeed the name of Ebizo ICHIKAWA the 8th.
sen.cmt: temporally→スペルミスと思われるためtemporarilyに訂正しました。in 1870→原文に合わせin around 1870に訂正しました。the 8th Ebizo ICHIKAWA→Ebizo ICHIKAWA the 8thに訂正しました。
sen.e: He temporarily moved back and stayed in Kansai Region in around 1870, but once again he headed to Tokyo in 1881 in order to succeed the name of Ebizo ICHIKAWA the 8th.

sen.j: 東京では新富座で兄の市川團十郎 (9代目)と同座が多かった。
sen.e: He often played at the same Shintomi-za Kabuki Theatre with his elder brother, Danjuro ICHIKAWA. (9th succession)
He often played at the Shintomi-za Kabuki Theatre with his elder brother, Danjuro ICHIKAWA (the 9th succession).
sen.cmt: same→削除しました。（「同座」の部分の訳はwith his～の訳出だけで良いと思います）9th succession→the 9th successionに訂正しました。（前出の訳との統一）ピリオドを文末に置きました。
sen.e: He often played at the Shintomi-za Kabuki Theatre with his elder brother, Danjuro ICHIKAWA (the 9th succession).
